title: What is the equivalent of half a crown from Victorian times in modern money (England)? - Quora

response.answer_text: At 5p to the shilling and a half crown at 2/6, it’s 12.5p. However inflation does terrible things to the value of money money over a century and a bit,. While it may not sound like very much nowadays, that half crown pushed into your sticky little hand by a favourite aunt or uncle was a pretty decent sum when you consider the average annual income for a working man in England was perhaps a little under £50, or less than a pound a week

I’m going to assume you are probably asking because of Scrooge’s line in ‘A Christmas Carol” to the boy he sent after the prize goose. At the time the tale takes place, which is shortly after Victoria’s ascension, half a crown was half the wage of a skilled workman for a day, a carpenter say. So it would roughly be like saying to a child now “I’ll give you 100 pounds (or dollars)”. You can see why he ran off posthaste.
